sentences.en: A protracted malaise will spawn an angry search for scapegoats.
sentences.cn: 这种不满情绪会不断扩大去寻找替罪羊.

sentences.en: Campaigns of attrition are supplementary but necessary in protracted war.
sentences.cn: 战役的消耗战,是辅助的,但也是持久作战所需要的.

sentences.en: He has got a protracted, exhaustive siege of illness.
sentences.cn: 他得了一种长期而耗费体力的疾病.

sentences.en: However, after protracted negotiations Ogden got the deal he wanted.
sentences.cn: 然而，经过拖拉的谈判，奥格登还是得到了他想要的那笔交易。

sentences.en: It was the beginning of a protracted duel.
sentences.cn: 这是一场持久的决斗的开始.

sentences.en: Q : Can I avoid this protracted battle with my mind?
sentences.cn: 我可以避免与自己的头脑长期战争 麽 ?

sentences.en: The detection precision of the protracted temperature measuring electrode is 0.1 ℃.
sentences.cn: 经过标定的测温电极具有0.1℃的检测精度.

sentences.en: The money is supposed to meet a " protracted balance - of - payments need ".
sentences.cn: 货币通常被认为是用于满足 “ 延长的收支平衡的需要 ”.

sentences.en: The protracted idleness eat at him.
sentences.cn: 这样没完没了地一天天闲混,使他苦恼.

sentences.en: The struggle would be bitter and protracted.
The war was protracted for four years.
Their sex is rough, protracted, volatile and eventually, even loving.
sentences.cn: 他们之间的性方式粗暴 、 拖延 、 多变, 甚至怀有爱的.

sentences.en: They protracted their visit for some weeks.
sentences.cn: 他们将访期延长几个星期.

sentences.en: They've set the stage for a protracted struggle.
sentences.cn: 他们已作好长期争斗的准备.

sentences.en: We won victory through protracted struggle.
sentences.cn: 经过长期的斗争,我们取得了胜利.

words.tran_cn: 伸肌；分度器；伤处异物摘出器
拖延；绘制；伸展（protract的过去分词）

trans.tran_en: Something, usually something unpleasant, that is protracted lasts a long time, especially longer than usual or longer than you hoped

trans.tran_cn: 拖延“protract”的过去式和过去分词
